baseline_groups.claim_summary: Joint-liability microfinance group loans increase enterprise ownership among eligible households in rural Mongolia.
baseline_groups.notes: Primary result. Baseline coef = 0.0775 (SE = 0.0326, p = 0.026). ANCOVA specification with baseline enterprise control, demographic controls, and aimag dummies, clustered at soum level. N = 611.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Group loans increase sole entrepreneurship (a sub-measure of enterprise ownership).
baseline_groups.notes: Coef = 0.0851 (SE = 0.0380, p = 0.035). Same specification as G1 but with sole entrepreneurship outcome. N = 611.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Group loans increase total household consumption (in logs).
baseline_groups.notes: Coef = 0.1142 (SE = 0.0617, p = 0.077). Marginally insignificant at 5% level. Same specification as G1 but with log total consumption outcome. N = 611.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Group loans increase food consumption (in logs).
baseline_groups.notes: Coef = 0.1698 (SE = 0.0725, p = 0.028). Significant at 5%. Same specification as G1 but with log food consumption outcome. N = 611.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Group loans affect enterprise profits (scaled by baseline mean).
baseline_groups.notes: Coef = -7.85 (SE = 4.27, p = 0.076). Negative and marginally insignificant -- contradicts expected positive sign. Expected sign is positive based on the paper's hypothesis, but this baseline itself shows a negative coefficient. N = 610.

global_notes: Paper is 'The Impacts of Microfinance: Evidence from Joint-Liability Lending in Mongolia' (AEJ-Applied). RCT design randomized at soum (sub-district) level in rural Mongolia. All specifications use ANCOVA framework: cross-sectional OLS at follow-up with baseline outcome control. Treatment is group loan assignment (vs. control). The custom/indiv_vs_control specs use individual loan treatment (a different treatment arm entirely) and are classified as non-core different-treatment. Several robust/outcome specs (enterprise, soleent, scaled_profit_r, ln_totalc, ln_foodc) are exact duplicates of the corresponding baselines. The robust/fe/soum_fe specification failed (n=0, empty coefficients) because soum FE absorbs the treatment variation (treatment was randomized at soum level). The winsorize specs (profit_r_wins) are core sample restrictions for the profit claim (G5) since they apply outlier treatment to the same profit variable. Some alternative outcomes (scaled_assets, hours_total, ln_nondurc, ln_durc) test different claims not covered by the baselines and are classified as non-core. There are 66 total specifications, of which 1 is invalid (soum_fe).
